layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: The ability to do something well; expertise. Not just doing something, but developing competence — getting better through deliberate practice and feedback.

questions.text: I can navigate morally complex situations with wisdom — not just black-and-white cases, but grey areas that require discernment.
I have developed the ability to anticipate moral pitfalls before I'm in them — I see the trap before it springs.
I can explain the 'why' behind moral principles — not just that something is wrong, but why it damages flourishing.
I have practical wisdom about how to make restitution when I've wronged someone — I know what actually heals relationships.
I can counsel others through moral dilemmas effectively — my ethical skill is developed enough to help, not just opine.
